CatDescriptText: Mr. William H. Kimbo, 797 Cherokee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 2 with question: �What do you think of young men or boys who process their hair? Do you think it improves their appearance or not?� answer reads: �You�ve given me the $64 question.  I don�t think that it has improved the wearers� appearances.  They would probably look better the natural way-- the way which God gave to them.  As long as they keep it combed and brushed it is all right.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William H. Kimbo, wearing moustache, light colored collared jacket, and button down collared shirt, holding newspaper under arm, standing with hands clasped in front of large rectangular stone block wall
